title: How Many Calories in Semen?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in semen per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, and other nutrients for curiosity's sake.
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3.5 ml volume); composition based on typical seminal fluid (water, fructose, proteins, minerals).
disclaimer: Values are approximate and vary by individual health, diet, hydration, and frequency; not a dietary source—consult medical sources for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of semen contains about 20 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison, scaled to one ejaculation.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. 3.5 ml)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one ejaculation of semen?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 kcal for an average 3.5 ml ejaculation.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in semen besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly water, fructose (sugars ~2.5 g), trace protein (~0.2 g), and minerals like sodium (~30 mg).

faqs.q: Does semen have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low amounts: ~0.2 g protein and ~0.1 g fat per ejaculation; mostly carbs from sugars.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Diet influences fructose and mineral content, but calorie variation is minimal (15-30 kcal range).

faqs.q: Is semen a significant source of calories or nutrition?
faqs.a: No—it's negligible nutritionally; values are for informational purposes only.
